channel.title: When software got in the way
channel.description: A collection of workarounds and patches that I've written to deal with all sorts of software and life problems.

item.title: Getting lynx to print URLs of HTML messages on the side
item.description: Reading HTML e-mail in the terminal can be a bit of a pain

item.title: Monitoring memory usage for weechat script leaks
item.description: I was recently dealing with a memory leak within a script in `weechat`

item.title: Logging into a ZTE H158N with the help of expect
item.description: Jalal Sela already took the time to break into a sibling of this router on his blog

item.title: Removing binary data from (mpd) logfiles
item.description: I like to keep `mpd` logs around for statistics purposes

item.title: Getting Viber for Linux to play nice with apulse
item.description: Viber for Linux seems to work fine with apulse, except for taking the liberty of changing my system's volume to 100% shortly after starting

item.title: Using mailto URIs with mutt postponed email
item.description: mailto:// URLs are sometimes convenient to use, but they don't fit in too well with using a single mutt instance and having an aversion to windows popping up
